description: Example summary for a news article about tech regulation
input_snippet: The European Union announced sweeping new regulations targeting major technology companies operating in the region. The Digital Markets Act (DMA) will come into force in March, requiring platforms with over 45 million EU users to comply with strict interoperability and data portability rules...

expected_output.summary_250: The EU's Digital Markets Act takes effect in March, requiring tech giants with 45M+ users to enable interoperability and data portability, marking the bloc's most aggressive tech regulation yet.
expected_output.summary_1000: The European Union has enacted the Digital Markets Act (DMA), set to take effect in March, targeting major technology platforms with more than 45 million EU users. The regulation mandates strict interoperability requirements, forcing messaging platforms to work with competitors. Companies must also enable data portability, allowing users to transfer their data seamlessly. Non-compliance carries fines up to 10% of global annual revenue. Industry analysts predict significant operational changes for Apple, Google, Meta, and Amazon.
expected_output.tldr:
The European Union is implementing its most comprehensive tech regulation to date with the Digital Markets Act (DMA), effective March.

Major platforms (45M+ EU users) must comply with interoperability mandates, meaning messaging apps like WhatsApp must communicate with Signal or Telegram. Data portability rules require platforms to let users export and transfer their information freely.

Penalties for violations reach 10% of global annual revenueâ€”potentially billions for the largest companies. Apple, Google, Meta, and Amazon face the most significant compliance burdens. Industry experts expect the regulation to reshape platform business models across Europe.
